description: Students pursue guided fieldwork experience in China and Japan. Activities and readings in this course build on the topics from from ASIAN 210 and three semesters of language study. Students continue to explore their understanding of Asia through ethnographic observation, interviews, and site visits. Students develop projects and follow a process of inquiry that will help them understand how ordinary people construct "Asian" culture and society today. Offered annually during Interim. Prerequisite: ASIAN 210.
name: AsianCon2: Encounter Asia
notes: Course open only to students who have completed Chinese or Japanese 231 or
higher and who are interested in continuing with language study abroad over
title: Asian Conversations II: Encountering Asia
